Name: Boy Scouts
Description:
Boy Scouts is an Australian patriotic game first registered in 1911 by the National Game Company. Subsequent later versions appeared until around the 1930s.

The game is a simple roll and move mechnism along a path starting at the Australian red ensign flag and progressing to a final camp destination 90 moves away. The later version has the flag at the end.

Along the journey players can benefit or be penalized by landing on certain numbers, such as miss a turn, extra throw, advance or be sent back.

The player to reach camp first is declared the winner.

—user summary

Name: Box Quiz: 3 på Tid
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme '3 in Time'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here you get 3 simple questions that you have to answer quickly. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Box Quiz: Fodbold
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Football'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about football. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Box Quiz: Årsquiz 2015
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Quiz of the year 2015'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about the year 2015. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Box Quiz: Takt og Nye Toner
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'New Etiquette'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about modern etiquette. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Box Quiz: Mat
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Food'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about food. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Box Quiz: Årsquiz 2016
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'The Year 2016'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about the year 2016. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Box Quiz: Årsquiz 2014
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'The Year 2014'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about the year 2014. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Box Quiz: Eventyr
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Fairy Tales'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about fairy tales. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Box Quiz: Jorden Rundt
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Around the World'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about "Around the World". It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Plume
Description:
Plume is a bird-collecting card game for two players, and your goal is to attract the coolest birds to your birdhouse. Keep your varieties balanced to have the coolest house on the flock! In the game, players alternate taking turns, starting with whoever most recently flew. On your turn:


    Choose one card that is next to the pawn. Take that card into your area, called your birdhouse. Move the pawn into the space left behind by that card.
    If you divide the flock, place the group with fewer cards on the discard pile. If they are of equal quantity, you decide which group to discard.
    If the pawn is next to only one card, take that card as well. Continue until the pawn is next to at least two cards. 


The game ends when no more cards remain to be claimed. At the end of the game, each player may discard one card from their birdhouse to the discard pile. Check which type of bird appears most frequently in your birdhouse. Resolve the scoring effect of each card that is part of that majority. If two or more types are tied for majority, resolve the scoring effect of each of those cards, so try to keep the types balanced so that you can score as many of your cards as possible.

By combining two Plume decks, you can have up to four players compete in the same game.
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Zippity Do!
Description: 12 picture cards are spread on the table. One-by-one players take turns singing a song with one of the images. Remaining players try to be the first to identify what picture card is the subject of the song. Spot the song-Slap the card!

Name: Imagine It!
Description:
This is an educational game system created by McGraw-Hill. It is a workshop designed for small groups of children in Grade 2 who need extra help with reading comprehension skills. There is a set of six game boards (Let's Go Skiing, At the Ranch, Under the Sea, etc.) with lavishly illustrated pathways.

Players move along the pathway by drawing cards and responding correctly. The first player to reach the Finish space is declared the winner but all of the pathways contain bonus spaces to let slower players gain extra moves.

Name: Going Further
Description:
Hurray, your company just got a lucrative job: build a road between two cities.
But the computer managing the production line just went bananas and random building material comes out of the factory.
Do you give up? Well, partly.
Forget about joining the two cities with a wonderful infrastructure, just try to use the material as it is ready and build as much as you can!

Going Further is a very fast solo game, estimated playing time with standard rules is between 1 and 5 minutes (depending on the tiles you have). Its playing speed makes Going Further ideal to be played in group, challenging the score of your mates.

Going Further, in its standard playing mode, is a tile placement puzzle, as all the tiles are visible to the player. However, every game is different because only 32 randomly selected tiles, out of a 72 deck, are used for a single game.
The objective of the game is to built a continuous road by placing tiles picked from a limited number of available ones. As long as tiles are connected to the road, others become available to be chosen and played. The game ends when no more playable tiles are available.
The player shall choose the best strategy to unlock new tiles and prevent the game to end, while scoring as much points as possible. 
In fact, each tile grants a different number of points; the total score consists of the sum of each individual tile points.
Additional points can be added or removed from the total, depending on the achieved road final configuration.

The game can be customized making it more or less difficult, or by introducing a luck element.

When more than one person is playing, each player takes his turn as for a solo game. The winner is the player able to score more points, after each one had his chance.

—description from the designer

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Enemy Traits Pack #1 Supplement
Description:
Trait cards are used to give a particular enemy type more diversity (and often a bit more danger). This is the first in a series of Trait Packs that re-visit established enemies from Shadows of Brimstone, adding unique new traits to them, and making them feel different each time you encounter them!

This 19-card Supplement contains a set of trait cards for three different enemies from the original Core Sets of Shadows of Brimstone: Void Spiders, the Harbinger, and the Goliath enemies.

Name: XIII: La Mission
Description:
The game is based on XII, a Belgian graphic novel about an amnesiac who seeks to discover his past. This game is illustrated by drawings from the graphic novel.

In this card game, one player takes over the role of XIII every turn of the game. Other players receive secret roles based on the major characters of the book. Those secret roles can be allies or enemies of XIII. The player playing XIII will reveal a mission with a number. At their turn, players will play action cards with a positive or negative value. The player who reach the mission number wins the mission and XIII draws the next mission card. A round ends when the card pile empties. Each player then scores as many points as he succeeded missions. If XIII has an ally, they both share their points and the next player around the player takes on the role of XIII. The player with the most points at the end of the last round wins the game.

Name: Early Railways Collection
Description: This boxed set contains three games: Lancashire Railways, New England Railways, and Australian Railways. Components are reused amongst them and a variant is included for each game.

Name: Chocafrix'
Description:
Chocafrix' is a board game that was released with the first edition of the Trade Paperback Serie "Freak's Squeele".

It is an asynchronous semi-cooperative game for 2-4 players. The game takes place in a story from the Trade Paperback where the heroes of the story have to fight an army of gingerbreat in a giant bakery. One player will be the master baker and take control of the gingerbread army while the other players will play the heroes of the book and try to defeat the baker. All the heroes have movement and attack abilities and a different deck of cards to play their action. The baker can summon new gingerbread every turns. The heroes can fight the gingerbread army: the combat resolution is dice-based with a rock-paper-scissor-based bonus system.

The game comes with 3 scenarios and is replayable since the enemy is also controlled by a player.

The game name is a wordplay with the cereal brand "Chocapic", which is why the box does not have a standard game box size but a standard cereal box size.

Name: Mad Science!
Description:
Players take the role of mad scientists, trying to outdo each other with inventions while avoiding catastrophic explosions in their labs.

Game play is straight forward press-your-luck with dice. Eight dice, two each of four colors, are rolled and grouped according to the faces shown. Scoring dice can be rerolled to add further score, but non-scoring dice pile up and count against you.

The goal of the game is to have the highest score at the end of a round where someone passes the game threshold - 200 points makes for about a 15 minute game once you're comfortable with scoring.

Name: Tanks: Priest Tank Expansion
Description:
Carrying a 105mm howitzer in an armoured body
based on the M3 Lee chassis, the M7 Howitzer
Motor Carriage, nicknamed the Priest, was the
US Army’s most numerous self-propelled artillery
piece, with over 4000 built by the end of the war.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled Priest tank
1x Priest tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards

Name: Healthy Heart Hospital: Nurses Expansion
Description:
Despite a tumultuous administrative history, the famed community medical center, Healthy Heart Hospital, has received a large endowment providing new doctors, nurses and rooms to manage the ever growing needs. Can you put these new resources and employees to good use as you seek to keep up with the ever-growing demand from your patients or will you be crushed by more management problems? The fate of the hospital is in your hands.

5 new Administrators
2 new Doctors
5 Nurses
5 rooms
Updated/2nd edition Emergency Room

Name: Treachery
Description: Treachery is a collaborative or solo collectible card game of limited resources and alliance-building, where each game poses a unique win condition, and you must race time, coordinate efforts, and improve your odds in order to flourish and win.  Based in an original, breathtaking retro-futuristic universe of space adventure and conquest, characters are recruited by leveraging motives including exploration, wealth, and honor, and games revolve around combinations of intertwining plots. Risks include dwindling sustenance, strange and surprising hazards, and your loyal character cards betraying you and 'going rogue' at every turn.

Name: Kaiju Crush: Checkerboard / Oblique Promo Card
Description:
Double Sided 'C' Objective card.

Checkerboard: 3 points for having 4 Territory Markers aligned diagonally in a checkerboard pattern.

Oblique: 3 points for having 4 Territory Markers aligned diagonally as off-set pairs.

Name: Dice Racers
Description:
Put the pedal to the metal and race around the track! Be the first car to cross the finish line, rolling as fast as you can to claim the championship in this fast and frantic dice rolling game!
 Everyone plays at the same time, matching dice to zoom ahead. Use your action dice to move ahead or to cause others to break down. Save up to refuel, or rocket ahead from last to first!

Dice Racers is a real time dice rolling game, where your goal is to be the first to cross the finish line after a predetermined number of laps. Match two movement dice, and move that number of spaces. If you match all three dice (two movement dice and nitro die) you move the sum of those three dice. Land on action spaces and you may have to repair your car, sabotage someone elses, move ahead or move back. You can also steer others into a oil slick, slowing them down as well.

Build your track with the 35 road hexes...every race can be different! Play one race or three to determine the winner of the Dice Racers Cup!

Name: Warhammer Quest: Chaos Adversary Cards
Description:
Expand and extend your games of Warhammer Quest – both in the glittering lair of the Gaunt Summoner in Silver Tower and the subterranean catacombs of Shadows Over Hammerhal – with this set of cards, containing rules that add 41 Chaos Adversaries for you to battle against, using miniatures from your Warhammer Age of Sigmar collection.

Each of the cards features a profile and special rules for a model, with a behaviour table on the reverse. The cards either have rules for Exotic Adversaries, as detailed in Warhammer Quest, or Mighty Adversaries – rules for this type of Adversary are provided in the box.

The Cards

Disciples of Tzeentch
Gaunt Summoner (Mighty Adversary)
Herald of Tzeentch (Mighty Adversary)
Ogroid Thaumaturge
Kairic Acolytes
Tzaangors
Tzaangor Skyfires
Tzaangor Enlightened
Horrors of Tzeentch
Screamers of Tzeentch
Flamers of Tzeentch
Exhalted Flamer of Tzeentch
Familiars

Nurgle
Lord of Plagues (Mighty Adversary)
Herald of Nurgle (Mighty Adversary)
Putrid Blightkings
Plaguebearers
Nurglings

Khorne
Slaughterpriest (Mighty Adversary)
Skull Grinder (Mighty Adversary)
Deathbringer (Mighty Adversary)
Bloodreavers
Blood Warriors
Wrathmongers
Skullreapers
Bloodletters

Skaven
Warlord (Mighty Adversary)
Grey Seer (Mighty Adversary)
Pack Master
Rat Ogres
Deathrunners
Night Runners
Clan Rats
Stormvermin
Plague Monks
Giant Rats

Slaves to Darkness
Chaos Sorcerer Lord (Mighty Adversary)
Chaos Lord (Mighty Adversary)
Chaos Warriors
Chaos Marauders

Other Adversaries
Grot Scuttlings

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – Goliath Gang Cards
Description:
Necromunda: Underhive contains a number of Tactics cards, which can be used to represent the myriad tricks and schemes employed by the gangs. Expand your games of Necromunda: Underhive – whichever gang you play – with this set of 26 extra cards. Included:


     8 Goliath Tactics cards, which are for the exclusive use of the Goliath gang;
     12 Gang Tactics cards, which can be used by any gang in Necromunda: Underhive;
     6 blank Fighter cards – perfect for the Champions and Leaders in your gang deck, these have been stamped with the House Goliath crest. 


—description from the publisher

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – Escher Gang Cards
Description:
Necromunda: Underhive contains a number of Tactics cards, which can be used to represent the myriad tricks and schemes employed by the gangs. Expand your games of Necromunda: Underhive – whichever gang you play – with this set of 26 extra cards. Included:


     8 Escher Tactics cards, which are for the exclusive use of the Escher gang;
     12 Gang Tactics cards, which can be used by any gang in Necromunda: Underhive;
     6 blank Fighter cards – perfect for the Champions and Leaders in your gang deck, these have been stamped with the House Escher crest. 


—description from the publisher

Name: Mission: Escape
Description:
Escape-Room for kids from 7 and up.
To stop the counter, kids have to retrieve a key from a plastic cage, using dexterity. With this key they can activate a "Quizmaster" which gives them three riddles (on cards). If they can solve three consecutively they retrieve a second key, used to stopthe timer.
It can be replayed, because the riddles are card based and there are enough cards (with different levels of difficulty) for 20 games or so.

Name: Zooloretto: Castor
Description:
A promo expansion for Zooloretto. This promo was given out at the 2017 Ludo-Outaouais con. The promo is only available in French.

The expansion consists of one 1 tile with a beaver.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except:
The first player to fill his 6-space enclosure gets the Beaver's enclosure as a bonus and place it below his zoo near his barn. This player keeps the Beaver's enclosure until the end of the game and cannot put any other tiles on it. The Beaver enclosure allows the player to move up to three animal tiles from one or more trucks to his barn as a commercial operation. This action does not cost him anything, but it can only be done once during the game. The player then receives a coin from the bank for each tile thus moved.

Name: Kung Fu Party
Description:
Defeat your opponents with martial arts strikes in this party game designed and illustrated by Demis Savini.

Kung Fu Party is a game for 2-10 players, simple to learn, fast to play, able to engage anyone, even those who normally do not love the tabletop games. Players will be furry fighters, mimicking all the fighting movies, cartoons and videogames collection. Divided in two schools, the White Tiger and the Black Dragon, face your enemies with amazing martial arts strikes. The purpose of the game? Defeat all opponents!

In order to fight, the players use their red Attack cards and their blue Defense cards. Each of these cards is characterized by a “battle scream”: the longer it is, the greater the strength. It will be up to you to guess where the opponent tries to hit you and defend accordingly with correct blocks.

With the Challenge mode you can play even in solitary, facing one Boss after another until you reach the top of the tower for the final challenge!

Name: Honma-seibatu
Description:
This is a self-published expansion kit for Sengoku Gunyuden series.
"Honma-seibatu" (Honma dominated) covers the historical and hypothetical battles on the small north island of Sado.

Five scenarios are included in this kit.



Note: Honma was a minor clan subjected by Uesugui (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honma_clan)

Name: Eestimaa Puhas Vesi
Description:
Eestimaa Puhas Vesi (Estonias Clean Water) is a game of 2-6 players where players travel through Estonia trying to find clear water among other resources. After finding the Clean Water -piece player must return to the capital of Estonia, Tallinn.

—user summary

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Cacodemon
Description:
The Cacodemon is a Terror, costing 2 Power and 2 Doom to gain for your side. Once gained, if it is killed, it costs 4 Power to re-summon. It has Combat 3, but its real value lies in its Cosmic Terror ability.

Cosmic Terror (ongoing) no faction may move or retreat units into the Cacodemon's area, unless they are accompanied by a Great Old One. This includes movement-like abilities or spellbooks, except for Avatar.

The Cacodemon sculpt is credited to "Tidal 4".

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Dire Azathoth
Description:
Dire Azathoth is a new Independent Great Old One expansion.

How to Awaken Dire Azathoth:
 Control a Gate on an enemy Faction's Start Area.
 Pay 10 Power, and place Dire Azathoth into the Area.

Combat: Roll a die. Dire Azathoth's Combat rating is equal to the result of the roll.

Mindless Destruction (Post-Battle): Any Faction Battling in Dire Azathoth's Area gains his choice of either 1 Doom or 1 Power for every Unit that Faction Kills or Eliminates in that Battle. (Dire Azathoth need not be involved in the Battle).

Spellbook - Dire Azathoth.pngSpellbook - Dire Azathoth (The Blind Idiot God).png Spellbook Requirement: As an Action, pay 20 Power.
The Blind Idiot God (Game Over!): Immediately win the game, even if you do not have all 6 Faction Spellbooks or the most Doom.

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Nodens
Description: Nodens is often called an Elder God. But I suspect that this, too, is not a pantheon, but indicates some other status. It certainly does NOT indicate friendship towards Earth life. Read Lovecraft's stories of "The Temple", "The Moon-Bog", or "Hypnos", for examples. All three, in my educated opinion, have to do with Elder Gods or their equivalents. For that matter, I consider Hecate, referenced by HPL as "Gorgo, Mormo, thousand-faced moon" as an Elder Goddess. And also possibly the Magna Mater. So the Elder Gods are clearly able to be inimical.

Name: Agricola: Rozšíření
Description:
The Czech version of Agricola was published without Minor Improvement and Profession cards. This expansion adds them.

—user summary

This expansion brings to Agricola more other options to play. Improve your economy by new equipment and learn your family new job assignment. Game will be more fun.

E-Deck for basic play
I-Deck for interactive play
K-Deck for complex play

—description from the pulisher (translated)

Name: The Order of vampire Hunters: Shadroe 'Rat' Decatur Expansion
Description:
An optional Kickstarter exclusive crossover character from the Fireteam Zero board game which comes with the following that can be used with the Order of Vampire Hunters game:

1 highly detailed plastic miniature
1 Hunter ID card
1 Basic Weapon card
Downloadable Hunt

Name: Ascension: Valley of the Ancients – Project Beta Promo Card
Description:
Promo Card given with pre-orders of Ascension: Valley of the Ancients.

Mechana Construct

Cost: 2 Runes
Value: 2 Honor
Effect: Once per turn, when you play a Mechana Construct (including this one), you may acquire a card with Rune cost less than or equal to that Mechana Construct without paying its cost.

Name: Offend The World
Description:
The fast paced game of languages and offence.

There are 10 languages each with 8 swear words over four different levels of offence (Extreme, Offensive, Rude, Mild) The object of the game is to get rid of all of your cards by playing cards of the same language or same level of offence. When you play a language card you must say the word or you pick up two!

There are a number of special cards added to the mix which allow you to screw over other players and can get you out of difficult situations as they can be played on any card.

For an added twist there is always a RULE in play. This can be anything from picking up additional cards from saying the words in an accent to ending the game quicker. You can play a RULE card at ANY time to wreak havoc amongst your oppenents.

There is also a 'make your own' set for adding those extra special words!

How many can you offend?

—description from the publisher

Name: The Reformers
Description:
At midday on the 31st of October, 1517 in Wittenberg, Germany, an unknown monk named Martin Luther raised to question a total of Ninety-five Theses criticizing the Catholic Church for selling indulgences, among other issues. This courageous act was to become the beginning of the Protestant Reformation that would rock the entirety of Europe.

In this game, you become one of four celebrated historical reformationists. You and the other reformationists will meddle with each others' affairs, all the while aiming for victory by trying to achieve the as many meaningful results as you can, building your way towards the Reformation.

Before starting the game, create the action board by placing 12 tiles together in a ring. Each player will receive 5 cooperators and 1 disc. Each player's disc will be placed randomly on a tile on the action board.

The Luther player starts the game. The active player moves their disc to a tile of their choice that is 1-6 tiles ahead of their current location, moving clockwise.

If there are other players' discs stacked on top of your disc, keep those discs stacked on top as you move yours. If there are other players' discs below yours, leave those behind. If there is already other players' discs on your destination, stack your disc on top of the others.

After moving their disc, the active player must place 1 or 2 cooperators in their hand on the destination tile. Each tile has 3 cooperator spaces on which to place a cooperator. The active player can only place their cooperators on empty cooperator spaces on the destination tile.

During this time, if there is a cooperator placed on all of the cooperator spaces on that tile, an action will be performed. The player with the most cooperators on that tile will perform the action and is called the action player. The action player is not necessarily the active player.

There are 2 different actions printed on each tile. The action player is allowed to perform both of these actions 1 at a time in the order that they desire. They are also allowed to perform either of the actions or neither of the actions.

Each player who had a cooperator on the tile for which the action was performed can declare Hallelujah and receive 1 blessing counter each. The action player does not receive a blessing counter through Hallelujah.

If an action and Hallelujah were performed, all cooperators on the tile will be removed from the cooperator spaces and placed in the center of the game board. If neither was performed, the cooperators will be left on the tile. Either way, the next player becomes the active player.

However, players that do not own any cooperators can no longer become an active player in this round and will have their turn skipped. Also, if there are no players with a cooperator, and nobody can become an active player, the round ends right then.

At the end of a round, each player can return up to 3 of their own cooperators back to their hand. They can also return as many of their own cooperators placed on tiles as they please.

6 rounds are played in total. At the end of the 6th round, each player performs 1 action of their choice. Once everybody has performed their final action, the game ends, and points are calculated. The player with the most points is the winner.

Name: Tinmates
Description:
Battle for the Yard to gain Power and become the Prison Boss in this strategic area control game by Dranda Games

Tinmates is a strategic area control game that was created by Simon Milburn, of Dranda Games, for the 2017 Mint Tin Design Contest.

Players take turns to choose one of 4 actions - Deal to gain currency - Train to heal or upgrade - Bribe to gain advantageous cards - Fight to challenge the Yard or deal damage from the yard.

Players win by reaching the power goal (which varies depending on the player count). Players gain power by moving into the yard or by being in the Yard at the beginning of their turn.

—description from the publisher

Name: RE-LOAD
Description:
RE-LOAD is a major Expansion and Reprint to already existing LOAD Game.

RE-LOAD is basically a Miniature-Expansion to LOAD Base Game and comes with ~25 additional Heroes (Miniatures). Includes around 20 new items that Heroes can equip and adds additional forest cards to the main deck. The game mechanics and rules are not changed.

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Dire Cthulhu
Description:
As an independent Great Old One, his cosmic level psyche allows him to re-assign Battle results to Factions in a Battle Area that are now even participating in the Battle.

Send your big army, including Dire Cthulhu, to an enemy’s area where he has lots of tasty victims. Then, conspire with a 3rd player to move a single Cultist into that Area, and Battle that one lone unit. It won’t roll anything against you. And all the dice you roll against him, you can simply re-assign to all those tasty victims who are merely bystanders. They can receive all your rolled Kills and Pains, but do not get to retaliate! Cthulhu is indeed…Dire!

Also, if you replace the normal Cthulhu with Dire Cthulhu, you can use the “classic” figure for the original Independent Cthulhu Great Old One if you like (rules are inside the master rulebook). Yes, this means you could, if you were insane, use BOTH figures as independent great old ones in the same game. Cthulhu vs. Cthulhu!

—description from the publisher;;

The Dire Cthulhu sculpt is credited to "Tidal 4".

Name: Cthulhu Wars: Brown Jenkin
Description:
The Brown Jenkin terror expansion contains a new type of Neutral Terror. Created by the winner of 'The Thousand Forms' contest, Collin "Xollnic" Townsend, made into an actual miniature expansion!

Brown Jenkin's ability:

Loathsome Titter (Gather Power Phase): If Brown Jenkin is in an Area with an enemy Controlled Gate during the Gather Power Phase gain power from that Gate and all Cultists in the Area regardless of faction. (Your own Cultists do not provide extra power if in the Area).

Familiar (Post-Battle and Doom Phase): If Brown Jenkin is Killed or Eliminated in Battle immediately pay 2 Power and place Brown Jenkin at your Controlled Gate. (This is not optional). If you cannot pay, pay 2 Power at the beginning of the Doom Phase and place Brown Jenkin at your Controlled Gate. (This is not optional).

Name: Tal'Vos
Description:
Tal'Vos is a deck building/card building game for 2-4 players.

Each player takes on the role of Admiral for their noble houses Airship and battles it out with their opponents til only one is left standing and is crowned emperor.

The game features strategic, fast passed back and forth action seen in many CCGs, as well as deck building and card building mechanics where instead of adding new cards to their deck, players instead upgrade their cards by sleeving in clear transparent upgrades over the cards they already have.

Each turn, players set their speed and select an opponent to attack and play cards back and forth into either offense or defense pools. Then they compare statistics and if the attacker manages to meet or beat the defenders agility, they deal damage! After the combat round, players purchase clear upgrade cards to sleeve into the cards they just played and then put everything in their discard. After 2 turns, players shuffle their discard piles, creating a new deck with cards now modified by what they purchased.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Silver Line
Description:
Make a move. Make a deal. Make a Fortune. In the Monopoly game, players tour the board in a quest to own the hottest properties, railroads and utilities. Invest in houses and hotels, then watch the rent come pouring in. Make deals to trade with other players and also look out for bargains at auction. This Silver Line edition of the Monopoly game features a sophisticated look for serious Monopoly fans. It includes a foil-accented gameboard, 8 pewter-colored tokens, pewter-colored drawstring bag, and 2 black dice with pewter-colored pips.


     Foil-accented gameboard
     Features black dice with pewter-colored pips and pewter-colored drawstring bag
     Comes in premium packaging
     Features 8 pewter-colored tokens
     Fast-Dealing Property Trading Game
     It’s a Monopoly, Silver Line Edition


—description from the publisher

Name: TOUR OF DUTY: VIETNAM – A Roleplaying Board Game of Combat during the Vietnam War (1965-1973)
Description:
TOUR OF DUTY: VIETNAM is a Board Game of Combat during the Vietnam War (1965-1973) for one to four players. Players assume the role of American Soldiers or Marines during the Vietnam War by creating their own Player Soldier Characters. Player Soldiers are part of a Rifle Squad or Team serving in an Infantry or Special Forces Unit. Your Squad or Team will be assigned a variety of Missions that you must complete during your Tour of Duty. Missions include Reconnaissance, Intelligence Gathering, Ambushes, Raids, Search & Destroy, Hearts and Minds, Rescues and many others.
 GAME OBJECTIVE: The objective of TOUR OF DUTY: VIETNAM is to successfully complete a number of missions to locate and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the US Forces. The player can choose to play a short game (6 Missions), a moderate game (9 Missions) or a full Tour (12 Missions). Once all Missions have been resolved (successfully or not) the Player totals his VP and compares this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

OPTIONAL RULES: There are rules for playing as Australian SAS Soldiers and Rules, Counters and Cards for playing a French-Indochina War Campaign.

TOUR OF DUTY: VIETNAM Can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

—description from the publisher

Name: Ben 10 Alien Force Challenge
Description:
This game comes in a plastic suitcase, with a quite large board, 120 cards and two dice.

It's a kind of roll and move game, but special rules make the playing time longer and the gameplay more exciting. On certain places of the board there are specific 'challenges' or random 'challenges' according to the card the player takes. Challanges can be solved by a 12-sided die, and even 3 helper cards can add a bonus. For every solved challenge the player gets so called 'Omnitrix' cards.

Players have to use a 6-sided die for moving, but only the numbers 1, 2 and 3 can be found on it, and if they roll 3 then they may move backward, too.

The game ends for a player when he/or she reaches the center of the board, however the winner is the player with the most Omnitrix card. So it's a good strategy to move back every time if possible.

The story according to the prologue from the rulebook is that Ben Tennyson and his team (Kevin Levin and Gwen Tennyson) look for a 4th person to the team. The players compete for this opportunity.

Name: Steady Job Game
Description:
Steady Job is especially designed for students of junior-senior high school age who have learning problems.  Occupational research shows that persons do not lose their jobs because of lack of skills and knowledge but because of poor attitudes and a lack of understanding of the responsibilities involved in employment.

Steady Job is designed to reinforce the positive attitudes and behaviors essential to employability.

The object of the game is to be the first person to get a steady job.

—description from the publisher

The Steady Job Game is a roll and move game played with a d6 and  pawns on a liner advancement line from the Employment Office (start) square to the Steady Job Square (finish).

Landing on a red - square causes the player to draw a - card and follow the (negative) instructions.  Landing on a green + square causes the player to draw a green + card and follow the positive (instructions).  The negative cards usually send a player back spaces due to negative actions (overslept, missed the bus, poor manners, failed to finish work).  The positive cards reward players with advancing spaces for positive actions (on time to work, took a bath, cleaned work area, remembered to use safety equipment).

The game seeks to reinforce positive work habits and demonstrate the consequences of negative work habits.

The winner is the first player to advance to the Steady Job square at the end of the line.

—user summary

Name: Saga of a Dying World
Description:
Take control of one of the colorful characters and do battle with your opponents across a world that's tearing itself apart. Plan your strategy and stick to it as the ground underneath you shifts, or take advantage of another player's sudden move to devastate them with a quick attack. Take your turn, defeat your opponents, and touch the all-powerful Omega-Nova!

—description from the publisher

Name: RONE: The Aftermath
Description:
Discover the RONE universe in this new epic exploring dice game that use unique dice that you can craft during the game.

This game is driven by scenarios and players take role of group of people who wants to survive the apocalypse. But remember, they are not the only one who wants to survive and the danger lurks at every corner.

Explore the map, build your players deck, improve your dice and be prepared for unpredictable.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cats vs Dogs
Description:
For years cats and dogs have feuded over who was the greatest pet in the neighborhood. Today they have decided to settle the argument once and for all with an epic battle in the streets!

Cats vs Dogs is a two-player game. One player will control the cats and the other the dogs. Your goal is to take control of the yard friendly to your opponent – or scare them off the board. But be careful, the board is littered with distractions that will make your animals lose focus during the heat of battle. Can you lead your animals to victory?

Each player gets 10 pieces which are set up hidden from the opponent. Players move on a grid showing several houses and a street from the neighborhood. When two pieces occupy the same square, both players will reveal their piece and play a card adding to its value. The player with the highest total will win the battle. However, if you're fighting in a square with a distraction, you total battle strength will be reduced.

The winner is the player who can occupy his opponent's yard on the far side of the board. This is a lighthearted game that plays quickly and is simple enough for young children but with enough strategy to keep their parents entertained as well.

—description from the publisher

Cats vs Dogs by Chris Hansen is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Name: Box Quiz: Nordisk Mad
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Nordic Food'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about Nordic food. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Pipe Fabrication Engineering & Design Game
Description:
This game is designed to bring families and friends together have fun while learning basic, engineering, pipe fitting, fabrication and design skills, that are very useful in the construction, oil Gas industry.

It is an excellent and easy way to learn print reading, for:

Pipefitting and fabrication,
Piping engineering and design, 
Planning and estimating,
Piping welding  inspection and Quality Control, and many other construction crafts,

The game comes in a deck of 54 playing cards, and two sets of 6 Isometrics and P&IDs cards each set, plus an instruction manual.

It is a fun and easy to learn game, it can be played by 1 to 6 people of any gender form ages +8.

To play the game, you will use the different cards and build your piping spool as per isometric (ISO) drawings.

You will be simulating the main activities of a pipe fabricator/fitter, field engineer, planners, piping inspector, designer, etc. Starting from reading the prints, identify y select your materials to make the installation/fit (i.e. choose the right material "cards" then place it in the right location and orientation) as per isometrics and P&IDs  (piping blueprints).

—description from the publisher

Name: Box Quiz: VM
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'FIFA World Cup'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about the Fifa World Cup. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: KIWI
Description:
A family card game that develops concentration and memory.

The players play cards to move the kiwi, but the kiwi doesn't physically move on the board until the end of the round. Instead, the players must remember the movements. If a card is played that has already been used in that round, then it has no effect on the kiwi's movement. At the end of the round and at the end of the game the question is the same: Where is the kiwi? The winner will be the one that pays the closest attention, who has the best memory, and who most often correctly answers the question.

Name: Atomic Chess
Description: Atomic chess is a chess variant. Standard rules of chess apply, with the exception that all captures result in an "explosion" by which the capturing piece or pawn is removed, and all Black and White pieces in adjacent squares are also removed. Pawns in adjacent squares are not removed. The game is won by either checkmate or the explosion of the enemy King. Because Kings cannot voluntarily destroy themselves, they are forbidden to capture enemy pieces and pawns.

Name: Heisenberg
Description:
Heisenberg is connection game played on a square grid. Two players, Black and White, alternate placing stones on the intersections of the grid until one player connects his two sides of the board and wins the game.

Object of the game
A player wins when he forms a chain of his own stones which connect his two edges of the board. The chain can be connected orthogonally and diagonally.

On a normal turn, a player places one stone of his own color on an empty intersection of the board. The stone must have orthogonal access to both of that player's board edges. That is, it must be possible to trace a route from that intersection to each of the player's own board edges without moving diagonally or passing through an opposite-colored stone.

If at the beginning of a player's turn any of his stones do not have access to both of that player's board edges, he must pick up all such stones and redeploy them. The stone(s) may be placed on any empty intersection(s) of the board where they have access. He does this instead of his normal placement.

—description from the designer

Name: Wheel of Fortune Bingo Game
Description:
Combine two household favorites with this Wheel of Fortune Bingo Game by Mattel!

PRODUCT FEATURES

â€‹Just like on the show, the wheel has wedges, but in this game, most of them have three letters and just like in Bingo, you’re trying to complete a card.â€‹â€‹â€‹

â€‹After one player completes three puzzle cards, the player with the most points wins!â€‹â€‹
â€‹
There are good and bad places to land on the Wheel, and when it’s your spin, you’re in control of what happens. . .â€‹â€‹
â€‹
. . . unless you land on “Bankrupt” because then you’ll have to wipe your card clean! â€‹â€‹

—description from the publisher

Name: Prismal
Description:
Prismal is a cooperative card game for 2 to 6 players, from 10 years old, of about 15 minutes. PRISMAL is the first game from the anthropomorphic universe we are developing:"Kingdoms of Isempar".

The goal of the game is to decrypt the cards face down in the middle of the table. Team spirit and deductions will be required to decrypt these cards using the information provided by players as they play.

Pick randomly one card of each colour and place them face down in the middle of the table. These six cards are called "encrypted" cards.

Shuffle the rest of the selected cards and deal them all to the players.

Important: Players cannot communicate with each other about the cards in their hands. A player can only see the colour of other players' cards by looking at their backs.

During their turn, a player must perform one of the following two actions: 

     Place a card: The player takes a card from his hand and places it face up in front of the "encrypted" card of his choice, without covering the one (s) already placed. This card can be placed in front of an "encrypted" card of a different colour.
     The player takes a card from their hand and puts it face down in front of them. Players may at any time consult the backs of cards that have been discarded from the game.


The game ends when the players have no more cards in their hands or when all players have successively discarded a card. Then they flip the "encrypted" cards.
The number of cards placed in front of each "encrypted" card must correspond exactly to its value. Players then estimate their success rate based on the number of cards they have decrypted.

—description from the publisher

Name: Golem (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
Description:
"Golem" is a fan scenario playing in the near future.

The T.I.M.E agents are sent to the year 2025 NT using a reporter team from a local TV station as receptacles. The team wanted to conduct an interview with the director of A-TEC Industries, but just before the team arrived there was an explosion.

It is of utmost importance to find out what happened at A-TEC Industries that day.

Name: The Game of America Campaign
Description:
Goal of the game: You are a Political Party trying to control the 3 Branches of the Government. First control the States (Legislature). Next control the Supreme Court (Judicial). Then control the Presidency (Executive).

Roll and move to collect (purchase) States which increase the number of votes you receive towards the 280 required to win the game. When you control all the States of a Territory, you can start to add Support which will increase the income level for any State in that Territory.

Control the Supreme Court by appointing 5 of the 9 Supreme Court Justices. Appointment is scaled with the first requiring 50 votes and $500K, the 2nd 100 votes, 3rd 150 votes, 4th 200 votes and the 5th and final 250 or more votes. $500k must be paid in each case. Justices can be removed if your vote total drops below the required amount.

Controlling the Presidency requires 280 votes, 5 Justices and pay  Five Million dollars to the bank. This is how you win the game.

Name: Eight Is Great
Description:
From the box: First player to lose all their cards wins!  Fun for up to 8 players, ages 6 and up."

A card game that is basically Uno with a light LDS theme and without most of the special cards.  There are ten characters in four different colors as well as "Eight Is Great" cards as wilds.

Players are dealt five cards to start the game.  A card from the deck is flipped face-up to start the discard pile.  Players can play a card from their hand of either the same color or of the same character as the face-up card in the discard.  If they cannot match a card or play an eight is Great card as a wild to change the color, they draw one card from the draw pile.

Play continues until one player plays their last card and wins.

Name: The Exorcism at the House of Monkton Falls
Description:
Take on the role of a paranormal investigator and together with your friends banish the evil spirit haunting the House of Monkton. The Exorcism at the House of Monkton Falls is a cooperative board game for 2-4 players tasked with banishing a spirit from the ancient home in Monkton.

Take control of a paranormal investigator, gather tools to complete tasks, banish the gathering darkness from various rooms in the house, and escape the dreaded spirit before dawn.

—description from the publisher

Name: PMC 2640: Hell on Echidna
Description:
PMC 2640: Hell on Echidna is not only a demo version – it’s also a mini expansion for those of you who purchased the PMC 2640 rulebook earlier!

It contains all the basic things you need to play: core rules (identical to those found in the rulebook); a shortened terrain list; a special, new terrain generator for post-apocalyptic planets; rules for composing an army with basic equipment; a new scenario (not featured in the main rulebook); and a list of several units (including two new ones!) along with all of its special rules.

Additionally, it includs a new Battle Honour, which may be given to your troops if you decide to play your campaign battles on Echidna or a similar devastated planet.

PMC 2640 is the third wargame made by Assault Publishing and deals with warfare in the 27th century. Although there are plenty of sci-fi wargames, PMC 2640 has many interesting features which make it unique and very enjoyable.

PMC 2640 is designed as a ‘true company scale’ wargame, which means that it runs smoothly both with a few as well as a few dozen units on the battlefield. This was achieved by eliminating sophisticated, but unnecessary special rules, and limiting the number of counters to morale markers only, represented by D6 dice. The ruleset itself is compact and elegant, written in simple, “international” English, leaving no place for vagueness and multiple interpretations. On the other hand, PMC 2640 offers countless possibilities, as the rulebook contains a few dozen of unit entries, six scenarios and seven terrain generators, all of which ensure that no two games will look the same. The classic alternate activation (with small balancing modifications) makes the game fast and addictive.

Name: Washing Lines
Description:
Washing Lines is a set collection game where players try to score the most points by hanging out wet laundry items on their washing line and, when dry, putting them in their basket.

There's a small element of push your luck and a tiny bit of take that. The mechanic is a 2 card draw: You draw a card, decide to play it or discard it. If played then draw and discard the next card. If discarded then draw and play the second card.

Once either 3 laundry items of the same colour, or 5 of different colours, are hanging on the line (multi coloured, stripey, clothes being 'wild') they are dry and can be placed in the player's laundry basket to be scored at the end of the game.
There are some special sets to collect for bonuses and also Event cards for various effects.

Washing Lines was an entry in the 2017 Children's Game Print and Play Design Contest where it was voted
Best Game for Early Elementary School Children

—description from the publisher

Name: De Feiten van 2016 op een rij
Description:
Review the year 2016 with this 'talk & guess game'. Each time, three news facts are presented and the purpose is to put them in the correct chronological order. Score a point when guessed right. With the 'double or nothing' card, you can earn two points per correct guess.. or zero at all.
This compact and easy to learn game contains 104 news facts which allows for unlimited combinations.
—description from the publisher (Translated)

Een 'raad & praat-spel' waarmee je gezamenlijk spelenderwijs het jaar 2016 nogmaals doorneemt. Steeds 3 nieuwsfeiten van het afgelopen jaar liggen naast elkaar... raad jij de chronologische volgorde? Per goed antwoord scoor je 1 punt... tenzij je de 'dubbel- of niets-kaart' hebt gepakt en strijd voor 2... of 0 punten per goed antwoord! Dit handzame, eenvoudige en leerzame spel bevat 104 nieuwsfeiten die in ontelbaar veel combinaties gespeeld kunnen worden.
—description from the publisher (Dutch)

Name: MBT: 4CMBG
Description:
This 3rd MBT expansion focuses on Canada’s armored and mechanized forces. The 4th Canadian Mechanized Brigade Group (4CMBG) is the forward element of Canadian Forces Europe. Positioned at Lahr in Southern West Germany, the brigade is poised to support VII (US) Corps and II (FRG) Corps against incursions from Soviet GSFG or CGF forces.

This box contains 5 new scenarios. The 2 new double-sided geomorphic maps can be combined with all other MBT base game and expansion maps to create new battlefields. Detailed TO&E for the Canadian Brigade is also included.

In order to play this expansion onlz the MBT basic game is required. The MBT: BAOR and/or MBT: FRG expansions are not.

New features:

    Blowpipe and ITOW section counters
    APFSDS ammunition for Leopard C1
    Spot Small Arms, ATGM Dodge, NATO Target Acquisition Bonus, Helicopter Landed/Hover and VP Reference counters


Included Canadian units: Beaver AVLB, Leopard C1, Lynx, M113A1, M150, Leg units; Fliers: CH-136 Kiowa, CF-18B Hornet

Leaders as a new feature add a powerful dynamic to MBT. They represent individuals of various ranks and skills that can influence gameplay in a number of unique ways. In almost all cases, scenarios do not indicate the presence of any particular leader or leaders. Players may freely add any number of leaders or none at all. Just decide by mutual agreement. Follow the recommended command structure below, or just go with whatever works. There is no correct or incorrect approach as battlefield conditions make for very fluid situations. There may be occasions where junior officers or NCOs find themselves in overall command or senior officers are commanding only a small contingent.

Leader Effects:

    (A) AP Combat: + AP Hit Modifier
    (G) GP Combat: + GP Dice Roll Modifier
    Close Assault: + dice roll modifier (use (G) modifier)
    Hand-to-Hand: + dice roll modifier (use (G) modifier)
    Overrun: + GP dice roll modifier (use (G) modifier)
    (S) Suppression Recovery: - dice roll modifier
    (M) Morale: + dice roll modifier
    (P) Spotting: + Spotting Ranges modifier
    (R) IF Response: + Indirect Fire Response modifier



Box contents:

    1 8½” x 11” Counter Sheet
    2 double-sided, 10x27 inch, geomorphic mapboards
    5 double-sided full-color 5” x 4” Data Cards
    24 page Playbook

Name: Card in the Hat
Description:
A game where two teams of players throw playing cards into a hat. Players each have 8 cards and take it in turns to throw these into the hat, scoring one point for their team every success. 
When all players are out of cards they collect them and then take it in turns to throw their cards two at the time, then four at a time then finally all 8 at once. 
The team with the highest score wins.

Name: Kingdomino: Age of Giants
Description:
The giants have come to Kingdomino! And they will crush all your precious buildings if you can't find a way to send them off to one of your opponents' kingdoms.

Kingdomino: Age of Giants is an expansion that requires  either Kingdomino or Queendomino to play. This expansion adds new dominoes, new giant tokens, new challenge tiles, and additional components to allow a fifth player to join the game.

The new dominoes are shuffled in with those from the base game. If, on your turn, you add a domino with a giant on it to your kingdom, then you must also add a giant token, covering up any one crown of your choosing in your kingdom. If you add a tile with footsteps to your kingdom, then you get to remove a giant token from your kingdom and give it to an opponent, who then covers up a crown in their own kingdom. Covered crowns do not score points at the end of the game.

Traditional end-of-game bonuses are also eliminated. Instead, before the start of each game, two challenge tiles are drawn. These provide additional ways to earn points. For example, get 5 bonus points for each lake tile that surrounds your castle or get 20 bonus points if your castle is located in one of the four corners of your kingdom.

Name: Napgammon
Description:
"Napgammon" is a light weight wargame of luck and maneuver. It takes the core roll-and-move mechanism of Backgammon and applies it to a two-dimensional point-to-point map with differentiated terrain and movement costs. As in Backgammon, players roll two dice at the start of their turn and make one move for each die. Rolling doubles allows four moves, but also enables multiple divisions that begin the turn stacked together to move as one, potentially achieving superior combat odds and an advantageous column shift. Combat is resolved using an odds-based, but completely deterministic, CRT, and losses are permanent. A pool of reinforcements can be brought in from your Capitol city. The game is won by either completely surrounding your opponent's Capitol, or by Eliminating sufficient enemy units that you outnumber them two-to-one.

This is the second of Hollandspiele's annual holiday mini-games, the first of which (Christmas at White Mountain) gave birth to the successful Table Battles. It will be packed in, free of charge, with any order placed during the 2017 holiday sale containing at least two games. After the sale, it will be made available for purchase as a downloadable PNP game.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Guns in the Pacific
Description:
Base game includes support for two to five; Japanese and Indonesian Imperial players versus American, Australian, and British Allied players.  Plan your advances across thirteen sea zones to control twenty pivotal bases in the Pacific Theater of World War II. Win conflicts to gain more materiel. Battleships, carriers, and heavy cruisers represented.

Choose whether to respond to each conflict depending on the stakes, until forces get too close.  Adjust your task force before battle with intelligence and supplement more ships using oil.  Cruisers allow early disengagement and protection from submarines; battleships are best if the battle occurs at night; carriers are best in daylight.

Each ship card is unique with different amounts of armor, ammunition, anti-aircraft guns, command capability, damage control, engine speed, and fuel consumption.  Hits to ships knock out individual features depending on hit location.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Glory of Rome
Description:
Technically The Glory of Rome is the title of a "Series of Historical-Political-Military Conflict-Simulations about the Ancient World" (to quote the cover), and this is volume one, The Complete Approach to the Wars between the CARTHAGE and ROME of Scipio Africanus and Hannibal, but since no other volumes were published the series title is being used for the game.

The game is strategic, with a fairly small map covering the Western Mediterranean. There are 65 turns covering the entire period of the Punic Wars; players are not necessarily fighting the entire time as wars need to be declared and peace can be brokered by agreement. In between wars players can move troops around, get reinforcements, hire mercenaries, etc.

Land units are represented by a small set of metal miniatures (included with the game); army strengths are presumably recorded on paper although this is not made very clear. Naval units are represented either by paper counters cut from a possibly-included sheet or by borrowed counters. Historical leaders with special abilities enter and leave the game on a schedule.

Combat uses a fairly standard CRT but with die roll adjustments provided by players simultaneously choosing maneuvers which are cross-referenced on a separate table.

In addition to the leaders chrome is provided in the form of special rules for various locations, e.g. Sardinia has a chance of revolting starting on turn 16 unless it has a sufficiently large garrison.

Much about the game is unclear since Taurus Games' rules were written in a barely coherent stream-of-consciousness style.

—user summary

Name: Togo
Description: Togo is a miniature game that portrays naval combat in the Russo-Japanese War of 1904-1905. Miniatures represent ships and are maneuvered across a 4 by 6 foot area. Six-sided dice are used to determine various events, such as gunfire hits and the result of damage control.

Name: Darklight: Memento Mori Adventurers Pack
Description:
Delve deep into the Dungeons of Darklight: Memento Mori with these formidable new accursed.
Develop your accursed with 20 Skill Cards each and a range of unique abilities.

Contains 4 new Heroes:
-Nephilim
-Necromancer
-Revenant
-Courtesan

Name: Darklight: Memento Mori Exploration Pack
Description:
Expand your adventures with those new horrors straight from the depths of hell.

With the exploration pack supplement your accursed will find incredible new loot. Beware of the Possessed Chest which lures and devours unsuspecting adventurers.

Battle the Faceless ones, but beware of their mind-shattering whispers, calling you to their cold, eternal embrace. Face the horrific Libithin, daughters of the Queen of Lust.

Use the new Environment Cards to your advantage; gain a blessing from a shrine or kick over a brazier and set your enemies on fire.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: The Elder Scrolls V – Skyrim
Description:
A Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim thematic monopoly game.

Enter the realms of Tamriel in this brand new Skyrim themed edition of the fast-dealing, property trading game, as you experience lore, characters and locations from the bestselling videogame. Whether your plans are to set up villages in Winterhold or construct huge castles in Windhelm, get ready to unleash your inner entrepreneurial spirit as you lay claim to some of the most valuable plots of land in Tamriel. Most importantly, you’ll learn the intimidating new Dragon shout “Fus Ro Deal!” as you bargain, buy and trade your way to success. Just beware those fearsome Dragons who may strike at any moment to destroy your hard earned investment.
Families: Video Game Theme: The Elder Scrolls

Name: Galaxy Explorer: The Duel
Description:
Galaxy Explorer - The Duel 
				
				
					OVERVIEWGalaxy Explorer The Duel is a dice rolling game where two players engage in space combat controlling one faction composed of a motherships supported by a fleet of squadrons. The mothership is obtained assembling 9 cards (poker size) where 6 cards represent an area of the mothership and the other 3 cards represent a Repair Bay, a Death Zone and a Damage Tracker. Squadrons come in smaller size cards. Galaxy Explorer The Duel is a dice rolling and worker placement game with a simple and quick gameplay.

During your turn you will assign crew to mothership areas to perform certain actions, you will spend deuterium to build up your fleet and improve your technology, possibly you will send assaulting squadron against the enemy mothership and finally you will fire at the enemy and will repair damage.

				
				
					SCOPE OF THE GAMEThe scope of the game is to be the first to destroy 3 main areas of the opponent’s mothership at which point the game ends immediately.

				
				
					COMPONENTS18 Mothership cards (poker size)
40 Squadron cards (mini deck)
14 Repair-ship cards (mini deck)
8 Technology cards (mini deck)
5 Red dice (crew)
5 Blue dice (crew)
1 Black die for activation and check rolls
8 Red cubes to track damage on the mothership areas
8 Blue cubes to track damage on the mothership areas
2 White cubes (8mm) to track deuterium
5 Lightning Bolts  (damage tokens)

				
				
					SOLO VERSIONThis game can also be played solo.

				
				
					WEBSITEGalaxyExplorer

—description from the designer

Name: Miniquest
Description:
Miniquest is a cooperative game in which players play the role of heroes who have been summoned by the King in a moment of despair. Argo the dragon is back and his armies have invaded the kingdom. Gosu, Jeju, Mana, and Ryu are the King's last hope!

Together heroes will try to stop the assaults of the Dwarves, the Goblins, the One-Eyed Ogres, the Undead, and sometimes Argo himself!

Heroes must defend the regions attacked by Argo's armies by placing their character standee on the card representing the region. Each turn, a player draws a card from the deck to determine which region they must defend. To repel an attack, heroes roll a die and use their special abilities by gaining XP. If they do not defend efficiently, the threat to see the kingdom falling under the claws of Argo will grow…

Argo wins the game if the deck runs out of cards, if the threat is too high, or if he defeats the heroes four or five times.

Heroes win the game if they gain enough prestige to force Argo to abandon the war, but prestige is not easily gained: Only a victory in combat against Argo or his strongest armies will reward the heroes with prestige!

Name: Booze!
Description:
Booze! is a party game for 2-5 people in which you have to be the first to reach the state of the exquisite drunkenness.

The players must collect points (called pints in the game) without losing all their lives (called stamina) in order to win.

The outcome can be diverse depending on the player’s strategies. Every game ends with a single winner or loser, so no one gets bored while waiting for others.

The Booze! is a card game about drinking, but not a drinking game, unless you choose to.

—description from the publisher

Name: Judgy McJudgerson
Description:
Judgy McJudgerson: The game all humans are good at.

We’re constantly judging people based on how their face looks. (Don’t even act like you don’t.) Now there’s a party game that turns those hilarious and, let’s face it, totally true stereotypes into hours of entertainment. Now you and your friends can sit around judging and laughing at other people that aren’t in the room.

Here’s how it works:

The judge picks a random person’s face from the yellow deck.
Everyone plays a brutal Judgement Card from their hand.
The judge selects the most accurate and offensive insult.

In a country more divided than ever, we might as well play a game that divides it just a little bit more.

—description from the publisher

Name: Harvest Hoppers
Description:
Bike-riding frog-people deliver fresh produce from local farmers to a city on holiday. You will deliver pumpkins, corn, mushrooms, and more to the cozy restaurants and cafés of Greenbranch in the Verdant Isles. So put the pedal to the produce and get hopping! These deliveries need to make it there fresh -- and before your competition!

Players race their bicycles with baskets of vegetables to deliver, claiming daily area majorities plus scaled-up points at game's end for specializing in types of restaurants. Semi-random tile placement, scalable map size, asymmetric starting locations, and optional secret goal cards add variety. A player's turn takes only seconds so there is constant engagement.

—description from the publisher

[formerly Sightseer: Holiday Island]

Name: This War of Mine: Memories From the Past
Description: Memories From The Past focuses heavily on the storytelling aspect of the game. It is a non-systematic way of checking what the chosen Character is thinking - the drawn Character checks how he or she would react to the current situation based on the Character’s background and personality.
Families: Game: This War of Mine (Awaken Realms)

Name: This War of Mine: Incidents
Description: This expansion comes with 3 additional scenarios for the game, additional cards, tokens and secret rewards for completing scenarios hidden in the envelopes.
Families: Game: This War of Mine (Awaken Realms)

Name: Crown of Aragón: James Leader Promo
Description:
First released in 2017 at PAX Unplugged.

This promotional leader card is available by meeting Crown of Aragón lead designer James Searles in person.

Leader cards add variable player powers to Crown of Aragón.

James' leader side allows you discard and replace a card you draft, or you can give up his ability to play his event side, which lets you draft in the middle of your turn.

Name: This War of Mine: Farmers
Description: This expansion will bring not only two additional miniatures, but will add more events, residents, night raids and visitor cards. Those cards will be created in the theme of cultural differences of the population, meaning those who fled into the city. Hostile or not, their ways of doing things tend to be very different.
Families: Game: This War of Mine (Awaken Realms)

Name: This War of Mine: Orphans
Description:
This expansion adds a game element that is often overlooked in war stories and goes beyond "civilians": children, who do not even understand the seriousness of the events that are happening. They just keep on living in their small worlds and it is your job to keep them safe and fed.

This will not be an easy task - this expansion will rise the difficulty level of the original experience. You now have a family, that doesn't offer much help at scavenging or building, but needs to be protected and taken care off.

This expansion will come with additional miniatures, fittings (such as a bike etc.) and special cards for children (each time when you will draw one at random it will give the kid some special characteristics). This expansion will also come with 30 additional story snippets added to the book of scripts that will be dedicated to children.
Families: Game: This War of Mine (Awaken Realms)

Name: This War of Mine: Sewers
Description:
This expansion will add another possibility for scavenging - you can check the sewers and try to find something interesting. This will come with modular cards that you will discover one by one, never sure of what is coming next.

This action will be also be available during the day. But the sewers are not safe - you can encounter other scavengers there, so this expansion will come with additional scavengers armed with melee weapons.
Families: Game: This War of Mine (Awaken Realms)

Name: This War of Mine: Tactics
Description: This expansion adds a whole new tactical layer to the combat in the game and an entirely new dimension to it.
Families: Game: This War of Mine (Awaken Realms)

Name: Weltmeister gegen Europameister
Description: World Champion Counter Europe Champion: Each player has 1 pawn (boxer) which he moves about the board. Movement is determined by a die. The World Champion begins casting, and then dicing is alternately done. The pips mark the steps that the boxers coming from their respective ring corners, take on the marked way towards each other to come to blows. If the attacker lands on the space occupied by his opponent, it means that he landed him an effective blow and scores a point. The fight lasts 3 rounds or til one boxer is knocked out. Winner of a round will be who has first scored 5 hits.

Name: Unstable Unicorns: NSFW Pack
Description:
NSFW deck. Adds NSFW themed cards to the game.

From the back of the box:

Get dirty: Shuffle 1 NSFW deck into your standard Unstable Unicorns deck.

Get filthy: Shuffle 2 NSFW decks together for a fully playable, fully shocking game!

Contents: 54 NSFW cards

Name: Unstable Unicorns: Apocalypse Expansion Pack
Description:
The end is neigh...
This expansion is only for the most relentless of players. Unleash the Unicorns of the Apocalypse, and get ready to take the destruction of your friendships to all-new heights!
Includes: 27 Apocalyptic Cards

—description from the publisher

Name: Ponies
Description:
Ponies is a horse racing game with dice.  Seven dice are included with the game, 6 with letters and 1 normal die.  Players start with an equal amount of money (in 1, 5, 10, 20 and 50 unit demoninations) and all start with a 5 unit in the stake fund.

Each players take turns at one roll of all seven dice.  The following word combinations are possible:

WIN - Player takes all units in stake.  This then starts a new game.
PLACE - Player collects 1/2 of the units in the stake.
SHOW - Player collects 1/3 of the units in the stake.
LEAD - Player collects 10 times the number of units indicated by nunber on normal die from the stake.
PACE or RACE - Player collects 5 times the number of units indicated by number on the normal die from the stake.
REAR - Player neither collects or donates.
If none of the above words appear on role, player then donates number of units indicated on the normal die to the stake.

Player can never collect more money than is in the stake.  When there is no more money in the stake, all players donate five unites apiece to the stake.

Game continues until someone gets WIN.

Alternate game play: Only play with rules for WIN, PLACE or SHOW.

—user summary

Name: Button Men: Beat People Up – Doctor Lucky Promo Card
Description:
This card features "Doctor J. Robert Lucky" from Kill Doctor Lucky.

Doctor Lucky has a special ability as well as a strange dice size.

Doctor's Luck: If Doctor Lucky has only one die, you must flip a coin after attacking it. If the flip is heads, the die remains in play.

Size 19.5 Die: Use a d20, but if the roll is 20, flip a coin. If the flip is heads, treat it as a value of 19.5. Otherwise, reroll it.

This promo card was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #214 (December 2017).

Name: Samhain: Useful Items
Description:
This expansion for Samhain contains 3 tokens and 4 additional place cards.

Tokens:

     Magic Cauldron: It allows players to move more members of the clan.
     Gladius: Influence the action cards that can be used in each turn.
     Magic Potion: Provides additional powers to those who own it.


Cards:

     Spring: allows you to use your items at best.
     Sacred Oak: Provides bonus resources during the game.
     Circle of Stones: Allows you to manage the will-o-wisp tokens easily.

Name: Battle Tanks
Description:
This is a game based on 8-bit video game "Battle City".

In this game players control their tanks on the modular board and strive to destroy bot-tanks and capture the eagle to get victory points. The game is  continious until three eagles were captures or one player scored 5 points more than the next one after him.

Each player own his deck and takes cards in a hand from it. To perform actions players play cards from hand - so they can rotation and move their tanks.
First, players choose cards for first and second maneuver facedown. It can be any namber of rotation cards, but only one move action.
Now start with the first player and continue the clockwise players perform their first maneuver, then move all the bot-tanks by special rules. When all tanks moved, they shoot on target. Player's tank can shoot on the brick wall or any other tanks. Bot-tanks can shoot only at player's tank. All shoot is simultaneously.
If a player's tank shoot at bot-tank, they is destroy now, and player get a victory point. Now a bonus tile is placed On a battlefield.
If the player's tank is shot, player must discard 2 cards. If he can not, his tank is destroyed until this round ends.
After the first maneuver is performed, players perform second maneuver. After second maneuver a round is ending and players prepare to the next round.

—user summmary

Name: Too Many Bones: Forbidden Gems Promo Card
Description:
Too Many Bones promo card.

Promo 003
It is a single-use 'Trove Loot' card. 4 Lever, 5 Trip, 4 Force.
Card reads, "Merchants offer you 2 Loot of your choice in exchange for these gems (search Loot Deck and choose 2 Loot during your Recovery Phase)."

Name: Fedőnevek: Magyar bónusz csomag
Description:
The bonus pack contains 10 double-sided cards, most of which are names of famous Hungarian people.

Balaton / Kékes
Latinovits / Hofi
Széchenyi / Rákóczi
Csontváry / Puskás
István / Árpád
Rubik / Polgár
Buda / Dobó
Liszt / Bartók
Jókai / Molnár
Karinthy / Ady

Name: Streets and Alleys
Description: Streets and Alleys is a solitaire card game using a traditional deck of 52 cards. The goal of the game is to build up four foundations in suit from ace to king. The tableau is laid out in four columns of seven and four columns of six cards. The top card of each column is available to play. The card may be moved to the foundation if fits or to build a tableau pile down regardless of suit. Empty tableaus can be filled with any card. Cards may be only moved one at a time.
